channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown tree full of mistletoe, 1st March
item.description:
This tree is very tall and overgrown, has many dead branches which reveal themselves when it is in leaf, and it is full of mistletoe. In high winds large branches often break off. This tree was earmarked for work last week, on Thursday 26 Feb. However, no tree work occurred and the tape and street cones were simply removed. Please could you arrange the correct maintenance ASAP. Other trees in the street which were similarly blighted with mistletoe have been cut back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Brackley Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Racist graffiti, 1st March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Large pothole at 8 pelton road, 1st March
item.description:
After this winter’s rains another pothole appeared around the east greenwhich conservation area, in Pelton road (close to St Joseph’s Catholic Church). It would be nice if there was a larger programme to deal with _all_ of these potholes in one go. Sure would make voting for the current council more appealing at May’s elections …

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colomb Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken floodlights on tennis courts 3 and 4, 1st March
item.description:
Floodlights on tennis courts 3 and 4 at Hackney Downs Park are not working. Group lessons (paid for in advance) are now done in the dark and people book and pay for courts to then abandon the match. This has been ongoing for at least two weeks. Thanks.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footpaths Across Hackney Downs, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: LED Bright light right beside bedrooms, 1st March
item.description:
LED lighting equivalent to football pitch lighting. Not appropriate by bedrooms. high-intensity white LED lights were installed as part of a council upgrade, but the "toxic" blue-white light can contribute to insomnia, anxiety, and eye damage. Currently having lots of eye issues but at opticians nothing wrong with eyes and sleep is always interrupted since being installed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Casino Avenue, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
